segment.source: MD Control what admins can see in the Microsoft Intune admin console
segment.target: MD Control what admins can see in the Microsoft Intune admin console

segment.source: MD Control what admins can see in the Microsoft Intune admin console
segment.target: MD Control what admins can see in the Microsoft Intune admin console

segment.source: provides the ability to filter the admin console view to allow users to access only the items you want them to see.
segment.target: provides the ability to filter the admin console view to allow users to access only the items you want them to see.

segment.source: For example, you might want to allow only admin console operators to be able to update malware definitions, or reset the passcode on devices.
segment.target: For example, you might want to allow only admin console operators to be able to update malware definitions, or reset the passcode on devices.

segment.source: This is accomplished by using preset designations that you assign to specific users.
segment.target: This is accomplished by using preset designations that you assign to specific users.

segment.source: When these users access the admin console, they only see items specific to their designation.
segment.target: When these users access the admin console, they only see items specific to their designation.

segment.source: Use this feature to help you assign administration tasks to staff while still ensuring the security of your data.
segment.target: Use this feature to help you assign administration tasks to staff while still ensuring the security of your data.

segment.source: How to assign a designation to a user
segment.target: How to assign a designation to a user

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Admin > Service Administrators.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Admin > Service Administrators.

segment.source: From the list of service administrators, choose the user whose designation you want to change, and then click Manage Access.
segment.target: From the list of service administrators, choose the user whose designation you want to change, and then click Manage Access.

segment.source: In the Manage Access dialog box, choose the level of access that you want to give the selected user.
segment.target: In the Manage Access dialog box, choose the level of access that you want to give the selected user.

segment.source: You can choose from:
segment.target: You can choose from:

segment.source: Full access
segment.target: Full access

segment.source: Read only access
segment.target: Read only access

segment.source: Additionally, the Helpdesk - Groups Node allows users to choose from one of the following designations that provide custom levels of access to the admin console:
segment.target: Additionally, the Helpdesk - Groups Node allows users to choose from one of the following designations that provide custom levels of access to the admin console:

segment.source: See lists of users and devices (the user cannot use filters to modify the view.
segment.target: See lists of users and devices (the user cannot use filters to modify the view.

segment.source: However, you can use group filtering to modify what the user can see).
segment.target: However, you can use group filtering to modify what the user can see).

segment.source: For more information, see Use groups to manage users and devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information, see Use groups to manage users and devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Print the list of users and devices.
segment.target: Print the list of users and devices.

segment.source: Export the list of users and devices
segment.target: Export the list of users and devices

segment.source: View the properties of a user or device.
segment.target: View the properties of a user or device.

segment.source: Perform the following remote tasks:
segment.target: Perform the following remote tasks:

segment.source: Run a full malware scan
segment.target: Run a full malware scan

segment.source: Run a quick malware scan
segment.target: Run a quick malware scan

segment.source: Restart a computer
segment.target: Restart a computer

segment.source: Update malware definitions
segment.target: Update malware definitions

segment.source: Refresh policies
segment.target: Refresh policies

segment.source: Refresh inventory
segment.target: Refresh inventory

segment.source: Remote lock a device
segment.target: Remote lock a device

segment.source: Passcode reset
segment.target: Passcode reset

segment.source: When the user you configured next opens the admin console, they will be given the level of access you specified.
segment.target: When the user you configured next opens the admin console, they will be given the level of access you specified.
